p: Neuroinflammation plays a critical role in the pathogenesis of both acute and chronic neurological diseases, exemplified by stroke, Alzheimer's disease (AD), Parkinson disease (PD), and depression. During the neuroinflammatory process, immune and glial cells are extremely activated and release several proinflammatory mediators that cause neural injury. Thus, treatment or prevention of neuroinflammation-mediated neural tissue dysfunction may have a potential therapeutic option against neurological diseases [ 1, 2].
